original: bshad pa le'u drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: bshad pa le'u drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the sixth chapter.🔽In order to demonstrate the increase of merit through worship of the bodies explained in the sixth chapter, the seventh chapter is taught.

original: // / de ltar le'u drug par bshad pa'i sku rnams la mchod na bsod nams 'phel bar bstan pa'i phyir le'u bdun pa gsungs te ji skad gsungs pa'i sku rnams la /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u drug par bshad pa'i sku rnams la mchod na bsod nams 'phel bar bstan pa'i phyir le'u bdun pa gsungs te ji skad gsungs pa'i sku rnams la /
translated: With regard to the bodies as they have been explained,

original: me tog ji skad gsungs de bzhin gshegs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: me tog ji skad gsungs de bzhin gshegs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: flowers as they have been explained, and the Tathāgata as he has been explained,

original: rab tu gnas pa'i cho gas lha rnams spyan dbye ba bya zhing dbang bskur na /
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa'i cho gas lha rnams spyan dbye ba bya zhing dbang bskur na /
translated: If one opens the eyes of the deities with the rite of consecration and bestows initiation,

original: bsod nams rgyas shing 'dod pa 'grub pas na bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nams rgyas shing 'dod pa 'grub pas na bya ba ste /
translated: one's merit will increase and one's desires will be fulfilled.

original: rgyal srid 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'jam dpal gyi gzugs gser las bzhengs pa la tsandan dang / gur kum aa ka ru sbyar bas bsangs pa dang / byugs nas mchod de autpa la la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: rgyal srid 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'jam dpal gyi gzugs gser las bzhengs pa la tsandan dang / gur kum aa ka ru sbyar bas bsangs pa dang / byugs nas mchod de autpa la la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa 'bul lo //
translated: If a yogin who desires a kingdom makes an image of Manjusri out of gold, purifies it with a mixture of sandalwood, saffron, and aloe, anoints it, worships it, and makes offerings of utpalas, etc.,

original: nges rgyal srid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges rgyal srid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will certainly obtain a kingdom.

original: yang longs spyod 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas dngul las byas pa'i sku gzugs bzhengs pa la dbang bskur zhing mchod pa bya ste /
analyzed: yang longs spyod 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas dngul las byas pa'i sku gzugs bzhengs pa la dbang bskur zhing mchod pa bya ste /
translated: If a yogin who desires wealth makes an image out of silver, bestows initiation, and worships it,

original: snga ma bzhin du byas na thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du byas na thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will obtain it if he does as before.

original: nad sel ba ni bsal lo //
analyzed: nad sel ba ni bsal lo //
translated: The removal of disease is omitted.

original: 'dod dgur sbyin pa ni zhes pa zangs las byas te /
analyzed: 'dod dgur sbyin pa ni zhes pa zangs las byas te /
translated: The granting of desires is as follows: Make an image out of copper.

original: zhi ba dang dbang dang rgyas pa dang / dgug pa dang / khon dang bskrad pa dang / bsad pa dang / gzhan bskul ba rnam pa bcu gnyis dang / gzhan @152a * //
analyzed: zhi ba dang dbang dang rgyas pa dang / dgug pa dang / khon dang bskrad pa dang / bsad pa dang / gzhan bskul ba rnam pa bcu gnyis dang / gzhan @152a * //
translated: The twelve are: pacifying, controlling, increasing, summoning, separating, expelling, killing, and inciting others.

original: yang yid la gang 'dod pa dag bskul zhing bsgrubs na 'byor par byed pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sku las grub pa bzhin du khro bo rnam bcu dag gam /🔽phyag rgya rnams las bsgrub pa bshad de /
analyzed: yang yid la gang 'dod pa dag bskul zhing bsgrubs na 'byor par byed pa'o // de bzhin du sku las grub pa bzhin du khro bo rnam bcu dag gam / phyag rgya rnams las bsgrub pa bshad de /
translated: Moreover, whatever one desires in one's mind, if one incites and accomplishes it, it will be accomplished.🔽Similarly, as with the peaceful [deities], the wrathful [deities] are explained to be accomplished from the body, the ten wrathful [deities],

original: khro bo'am yang na phyag rgya'ang rung //
analyzed: khro bo'am yang na phyag rgya'ang rung //
translated: or from the seals.

original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /
translated: It is said:🔽Either the wrathful [deities] or the seals.

original: tri sh'u la rtse gsum pa'i sgrub pa dang por bshad do //
analyzed: tri sh'u la rtse gsum pa'i sgrub pa dang por bshad do //
translated: The accomplishment of the trident is explained first.🔽Then, it is said:

original: de nas khro bo gtso bo yi //
analyzed: de nas khro bo gtso bo yi //
translated: Next, the principal wrathful [deity].

original: zhes pa la gshin rje gshed kyi sgrub pa bshad de /
analyzed: zhes pa la gshin rje gshed kyi sgrub pa bshad de /
translated: The accomplishment of Yamantaka is explained.

original: dang por stong pa nyid dang / 'byung ba bzhi dang / ri rab kyi mthar sgrub pa'i thabs las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dang por stong pa nyid dang / 'byung ba bzhi dang / ri rab kyi mthar sgrub pa'i thabs las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: First, it is like the method of accomplishment in emptiness, the four elements, and at the end of Mount Meru.

original: aom las 'khor lo'i steng du yi ge tri dkar po las tri sh'ul rtse gsum pa'o //
analyzed: aom las 'khor lo'i steng du yi ge tri dkar po las tri sh'ul rtse gsum pa'o //
translated: From the syllable Oṃ, above the wheel, there is a white syllable Tri, from which there is a trident.

original: de las gshin rje gshed sku mdog sngo bas mdangs phyung ba dkar po'o //
analyzed: de las gshin rje gshed sku mdog sngo bas mdangs phyung ba dkar po'o //
translated: From that, there is a blue Yamāri, the color of the glow of dawn.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma sngon mo dang lhan cig byung ba bdag gis bsams te /
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma sngon mo dang lhan cig byung ba bdag gis bsams te /
translated: He is imagined to arise together with a blue knowledge-woman who is similar to himself.

original: zhal gcig pa la gdangs pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig pa la gdangs pa /
translated: He has one face, which is gaping,

original: gsus pa che ba phyag drug pa g-yas na tri sh'u la dang / 'khor lo dang rdo rje'o g-yon pa sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang dag sta dang dril bu'o //
analyzed: gsus pa che ba phyag drug pa g-yas na tri sh'u la dang / 'khor lo dang rdo rje'o g-yon pa sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang dag sta dang dril bu'o //
translated: and six arms. In his right hands he holds a trident, a wheel, and a vajra; in his left hands he makes a threatening gesture, holds a noose, a sword, and a bell.

original: yum dril bu dang thod pa'o //
analyzed: yum dril bu dang thod pa'o //
translated: His consort holds a bell and a skull.

original: zhabs bzhi pa ma he dang nyi ma'i steng na bzhugs pa /
analyzed: zhabs bzhi pa ma he dang nyi ma'i steng na bzhugs pa /
translated: He has four feet and stands on a water buffalo and a sun.

original: sgra sgrogs pa yi dags kyi khang pa rnam par snang mdzad dbu la gzhugs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / spyan drang ba dang mchod pa dag byas la gshegs par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra sgrogs pa yi dags kyi khang pa rnam par snang mdzad dbu la gzhugs pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / spyan drang ba dang mchod pa dag byas la gshegs par bya'o //
translated: He is imagined to be in a house of ghosts, resounding with the sound of “Hum,” with Vairocana on his head, and he is consecrated and invited and worshipped, and then he should be dismissed.

original: gzhan dag la sbyor ba ni gsal lo //
analyzed: gzhan dag la sbyor ba ni gsal lo //
translated: The application to others is clear.

original: aom aa m'a na ta kri ta ru ru sphu ru dzva la tishtha siddha lo tsa na sarba aartha sa dha ni sv'a h'a zhes pa ni bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: aom aa m'a na ta kri ta ru ru sphu ru dzva la tishtha siddha lo tsa na sarba aartha sa dha ni sv'a h'a zhes pa ni bzlas pa'o //
translated: Oṃ, accomplish the work of Āmantakrīḍa, with the sound of ru ru, blazing, standing, with the lamp of accomplishment, fulfilling all aims, svāhā.

original: de la che ge mo sh'antim ku ru zhes pa btags na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la che ge mo sh'antim ku ru zhes pa btags na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one adds so-and-so's pacification, it will be pacified.

original: aa si la zhes pa ral gri ste /
analyzed: aa si la zhes pa ral gri ste /
translated: Asīla means sword.

original: de'i sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa ni /
translated: The practice of that is as follows:

original: da ni ral gri bzang po yang //
analyzed: da ni ral gri bzang po yang //
translated: Now, the excellent sword

original: 'di ni bsgrub par rab tu bshad //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par rab tu bshad //
translated: is taught to be accomplished in this way.

original: ces pa ni khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i sgrub pa ste sku mdog dkar po ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i sgrub pa ste sku mdog dkar po ste /
translated: This is the practice of the wrathful Aparājita, who is white in color.

original: de'i rim pa ni sva las rin po che zur brgyad pa'i sting du si las ral grir gyur pa ni sa bon no //
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni sva las rin po che zur brgyad pa'i sting du si las ral grir gyur pa ni sa bon no //
translated: The stage of that is as follows: From sva, on top of a jewel with eight facets, from si, a sword arises. That is the seed.

original: zhal gcig dang / phyag drug dang / rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa /🔽g-yas na ral gri rdo rje dbyug pa'o //
analyzed: zhal gcig dang / phyag drug dang / rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa / g-yas na ral gri rdo rje dbyug pa'o //
translated: He has one face, six arms, and is in union with his consort.🔽In the right hands he holds a sword, a vajra, and a club.

original: g-yon du zhags pa dang / dril bu dang dgra sta'o //
analyzed: g-yon du zhags pa dang / dril bu dang dgra sta'o //
translated: In the left hands he holds a lasso, a bell, and a battle-ax.

original: gshin rje'i pags pa gyon pa ma he dang nyi ma'i steng du zhabs gnyis bgrad pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i pags pa gyon pa ma he dang nyi ma'i steng du zhabs gnyis bgrad pa'o //
translated: He is trampling on Yama and his wife on a sun [disc].

original: rin chen 'byung ldan dbu la brgyan pa sngar gyi bzhin no //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan dbu la brgyan pa sngar gyi bzhin no //
translated: He is adorned with Ratnasaṃbhava on his head, as before.

original: aom pradzny'anta kri ta ga te bi ka te /
analyzed: aom pradzny'anta kri ta ga te bi ka te /
translated: [Recite] “Oṃ prajñānta kṛta gate vikate🔽ni kani kate kaṅkate svāhā.”

original: ni @152b ka ni ka te ka tang ka te sv'a h'a zhes pa bzlas pa ste ral gri la sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: ni @152b ka ni ka te ka tang ka te sv'a h'a zhes pa bzlas pa ste ral gri la sgrub pa'am /
translated: This is the recitation. [The mantra] is accomplished with a sword,

original: yang na 'khor lor bris la mthar booshda sbyar na rgyas pa la shis so //
analyzed: yang na 'khor lor bris la mthar booshda sbyar na rgyas pa la shis so //
translated: or if written on a wheel and combined with boḥ, it is auspicious for increase.

original: phongs pa rnams gso ba dang / khyad par du dang / sgrub pa po dang nye ba dang / shin tu yang gso ba dag ste /
analyzed: phongs pa rnams gso ba dang / khyad par du dang / sgrub pa po dang nye ba dang / shin tu yang gso ba dag ste /
translated: [The mantra] is for the relief of the poor, for special [purposes], for bringing about the presence of the practitioner, and for complete relief.

original: rgyas pa las so//
analyzed: rgyas pa las so//
translated: [It is] from the increase [branch].

original: dkyus ni gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: dkyus ni gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The text is clear.

original: da ni be con bsgrub pa bshad //
analyzed: da ni be con bsgrub pa bshad //
translated: Now, the accomplishment of the club is explained.

original: ces pa ni sngar gyi bzhin te /
analyzed: ces pa ni sngar gyi bzhin te /
translated: This is as before.

original: gzhan khro bo rta mgrin gyi sgrub thabs te /
analyzed: gzhan khro bo rta mgrin gyi sgrub thabs te /
translated: [It is] the method of accomplishing the other wrathful Hayagrīva.

original: de'i rim pa ni aa las padma dang / der da las be con te sa bon no //
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni aa las padma dang / der da las be con te sa bon no //
translated: His stage is as follows: From a arises a lotus, and on that from da a club. These are the seed [syllables].

original: de yang padma ta kri ta ces pa ni padma la chus ma gos pa bzhin du nyon mongs pas ma gos shing /
analyzed: de yang padma ta kri ta ces pa ni padma la chus ma gos pa bzhin du nyon mongs pas ma gos shing /
translated: Moreover, Padmantaka means that just as a lotus is not soiled by water, so one is not soiled by afflictions.

original: de spong bar mdzad pa ni padm'anta krida ste /
analyzed: de spong bar mdzad pa ni padm'anta krida ste /
translated: One who acts to abandon them is Padmantaka.

original: zhal gcig gam gsum yang rung /
analyzed: zhal gcig gam gsum yang rung /
translated: One should have one face or three faces.

original: sku dmar ba dang / phyag drug dang / spyan gsum dang / rgyan dang cha lugs so //🔽phyag g-yas na be con dang ral gri dang / padma'o //
analyzed: sku dmar ba dang / phyag drug dang / spyan gsum dang / rgyan dang cha lugs so // phyag g-yas na be con dang ral gri dang / padma'o //
translated: One's body is red, one has six arms, three eyes, and ornaments and attire.🔽In the right hands one holds a club, a sword, and a lotus.

original: g-yon na dgra sta dang / dril bu dang / zhags pa'o //🔽'od dpag tu med pa dbu la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yon na dgra sta dang / dril bu dang / zhags pa'o // 'od dpag tu med pa dbu la bzhugs pa /
translated: In the left hands one holds an axe, a bell, and a noose.🔽One sits on a corpse and the sun, with Amitābha on one's crown.

original: zhabs bzhi yi dags dang / nyi ma la bzhugs pa yum ro langs dmar mo'o //
analyzed: zhabs bzhi yi dags dang / nyi ma la bzhugs pa yum ro langs dmar mo'o //
translated: One's consort is Red Vetālī, who sits on a corpse and the sun.

original: phyag na dril bu dang zhags pa kun kyang bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na dril bu dang zhags pa kun kyang bya'o //
translated: One should also have a bell and a noose in one's hands.

original: aom padm'anta krida ta re tutt'a re sv'a h'a zhes pa ni bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: aom padm'anta krida ta re tutt'a re sv'a h'a zhes pa ni bzlas pa'o //
translated: Om padmantaka tare tuttare svāhā is the recitation.

original: dbang du bya ba phongs pa ni nyam thag pa ste /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba phongs pa ni nyam thag pa ste /
translated: One who is in distress is distressed.🔽 🔽To be brought under one's power means to be brought under one's control.

original: de las skyob pa'i sngags 'di la ba sha ma na ya zhes pa'am dbang du gyis zhes pa ni sngags so //
analyzed: de las skyob pa'i sngags 'di la ba sha ma na ya zhes pa'am dbang du gyis zhes pa ni sngags so //
translated: The mantra to protect from that is vasamānaya, or bring under control.

original: de nas dgra sta bzang po sgrub //
analyzed: de nas dgra sta bzang po sgrub //
translated: Then, the accomplishment of the excellent mallet

original: ces pa ni dgra sta yongs su gyur pa'i sgrub pa ste ba ra shu'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni dgra sta yongs su gyur pa'i sgrub pa ste ba ra shu'o //
translated: is the accomplishment of the transformation into a mallet, which is varaśūla.

original: de yang ha las rdo rje rgya gram gyi steng du pa las so //
analyzed: de yang ha las rdo rje rgya gram gyi steng du pa las so //
translated: Moreover, it is from the syllable pa on top of a vajra cross from the syllable ha.

original: khro bo bdud rtsil 'khyil pa sku gnag pa phyag gnyis dang zhal gcig go //
analyzed: khro bo bdud rtsil 'khyil pa sku gnag pa phyag gnyis dang zhal gcig go //
translated: The wrathful Amṛtakuṇḍali is black, with two arms and one face.

original: dbu la don yod grub pa bzhugs pa gnod sbyin mnan pa rang gi yum nag mo dang gnas pa /
analyzed: dbu la don yod grub pa bzhugs pa gnod sbyin mnan pa rang gi yum nag mo dang gnas pa /
translated: Amoghasiddhi resides on his head, and he tramples on a yakṣa, abiding with his consort, Kālarātri.

original: phyag na dgra sta dang sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: phyag na dgra sta dang sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: He holds a mallet and a vajra cross.

original: aom bighn'nta krida /
analyzed: aom bighn'nta krida /
translated: Oṃ, Vighnāntakṛt!

original: h'um h'um h'um ha na ha na sa ta ka ma kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi h'um phat /
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um ha na ha na sa ta ka ma kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi h'um phat /
translated: Hum hum hum! Kill! Kill! Kill! Kha kha kha! Eat! Eat! Hum phat!

original: zhes pa ni bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bzlas pa'o //
translated: This is the recitation.

original: de la m'a ra ya zhes pa btags na gsod pa la shis so //
analyzed: de la m'a ra ya zhes pa btags na gsod pa la shis so //
translated: If one adds mara ya to that, it is auspicious for killing.

original: de yang bgegs rnams mthar byed pas 'jig par mdzad pa bgegs mdzad byed ste /
analyzed: de yang bgegs rnams mthar byed pas 'jig par mdzad pa bgegs mdzad byed ste /
translated: Also, since he is the destroyer of obstacles, he is the maker of obstacles.

original: bigh'anta krida do //
analyzed: bigh'anta krida do //
translated: He is Vighnāntakṛt.

original: gzhan du na yi dags phal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub thabs ltar tri sh'u la la sogs pa bzhi po @153a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na yi dags phal ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgrub thabs ltar tri sh'u la la sogs pa bzhi po @153a * //
translated: Otherwise, according to the sādhana of the maṇḍala of ordinary ghosts, one should imagine the four tridents, etc.

original: sor tshad bcu pa la sogs pa bsams la de'i nang du lha rnams bya ste /
analyzed: sor tshad bcu pa la sogs pa bsams la de'i nang du lha rnams bya ste /
translated: , ten finger-breadths in size, and so on, and place the deities within them.

original: bsten pa dang las bsgrub pa'am stong par ngal bso bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bsten pa dang las bsgrub pa'am stong par ngal bso bar shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that they are to be attended to, or one should perform the rites, or one should rest in emptiness.

original: man ngag go //
analyzed: man ngag go //
translated: This is the esoteric instruction.

original: yang na dpal gshin rje gshed 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan ma 'di rnams rang gi chos kyi phyag rgya'i steng /
analyzed: yang na dpal gshin rje gshed 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan ma 'di rnams rang gi chos kyi phyag rgya'i steng /
translated: Or else, one should imagine the signs of glorious Yamāntaka, noble Mañjuśrī, on one's own dharma-mudrā,

original: sran ma tsa na ka'i tshad tsam las dang mthun par kha dog bsams la /
analyzed: sran ma tsa na ka'i tshad tsam las dang mthun par kha dog bsams la /
translated: the size of a chickpea, the color according to the rite,

original: blo brtan pa dang las rnams bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: blo brtan pa dang las rnams bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
translated: and the performance of the rites with a firm mind is reasonable.

original: yang dag par sgrub thabs mang yang gcig gis kun grub ste lha mnyes pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub thabs mang yang gcig gis kun grub ste lha mnyes pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there are many methods of accomplishment, all are accomplished by one, because they arise from pleasing the deity.

original: dper na sa bon nus pa khyad par can las 'bras bu 'byung ste sa bon nus pa khyad par can ni chos can no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon nus pa khyad par can las 'bras bu 'byung ste sa bon nus pa khyad par can ni chos can no //
translated: For example, an effect arises from a seed with special potency; the seed with special potency is the subject.

original: 'di las 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba yin te zhes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di las 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba yin te zhes pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: The effect definitely arises from this; this is the predicate of the probandum.

original: mthu khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rigs pa'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mthu khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa rigs pa'o zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because of the special power, this is the reasoning.

original: las gcig mthu las 'byung ba dang / gzhan 'byung ba 'dra ste mthu las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las gcig mthu las 'byung ba dang / gzhan 'byung ba 'dra ste mthu las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One action arises from the power of another, like the arising of one thing from the power of another, because of the power.

original: bzhi par grub pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis zhi bar mthong yang dper na rnam par rtog pa tha dad pas dngos po gcig la mthong ba tha dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bzhi par grub pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang gis zhi bar mthong yang dper na rnam par rtog pa tha dad pas dngos po gcig la mthong ba tha dad pa bzhin no //
translated: In the fourth, it is established by desire. Even though one sees peace, it is like seeing one thing differently due to different conceptual thoughts.

original: lcags kyu la sogs pa de dag kyang de bzhin te gsal lo //
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs pa de dag kyang de bzhin te gsal lo //
translated: Those hooks and so forth are also like that. It is clear.

original: de yang g-yas pa drug bsgrub pa ni nyin gyi 'pho ba drug bsgrub pa ste khri phrag gcig dang chig stong phyed dang / brgya phrag gsum du ma yengs par mtshan pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de yang g-yas pa drug bsgrub pa ni nyin gyi 'pho ba drug bsgrub pa ste khri phrag gcig dang chig stong phyed dang / brgya phrag gsum du ma yengs par mtshan pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Moreover, the accomplishment of the six on the right is the accomplishment of the six transferences of the day, which is the sign of the one thousand and five hundred and three hundred without distraction.

original: rdo rje thabs kyi bzlas pa byed de /
analyzed: rdo rje thabs kyi bzlas pa byed de /
translated: Or, one should perform the vajra recitation of the method.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po yi ge gsum pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po yi ge gsum pa'i sa'am /
translated: Moreover, it is the three syllables of the essence of the Bhagavat.

original: phreng bar gzhan te sngags rnams so //
analyzed: phreng bar gzhan te sngags rnams so //
translated: Or, it is the other rosary of the mantras.

analyzed: de med pa ste ma spyad pa la yan lag tshang pa de snod yin te /
translated: The one who is without that, who is not ugly, who is complete in limbs, is a suitable vessel.

original: de la khrus byas la bdud rtsi lnga pos bkra shis pa blud la /
analyzed: de la khrus byas la bdud rtsi lnga pos bkra shis pa blud la /
translated: Having bathed her, one should give her a blessing with the five ambrosias.

original: smyung ba byas te zhes pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa de stong par byas la /
analyzed: smyung ba byas te zhes pa tshul khrims dang ldan pa de stong par byas la /
translated: Having fasted means that one who has morality should fast.

original: yum ro langs mar bskyed ba'o //
analyzed: yum ro langs mar bskyed ba'o //
translated: One should generate the mother as a zombie.

original: yang bkrus la zhes pa lha mo la me long du khrus bya'o //
analyzed: yang bkrus la zhes pa lha mo la me long du khrus bya'o //
translated: Again, one should bathe her, meaning that one should bathe the goddess in a mirror.

original: gos dang rgyan can du bsam pa ni gos rnams dang ni rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: gos dang rgyan can du bsam pa ni gos rnams dang ni rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste /
translated: One should imagine her to be adorned with clothes and ornaments, meaning that she is adorned with clothes and ornaments.

original: g-yas brkyang thal mo snying gar sbyar ba rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa /
analyzed: g-yas brkyang thal mo snying gar sbyar ba rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa /
translated: With her right leg extended and her palms joined at her heart, she stands on a wind mandala.

original: rkang pa la yam bsam zhing /
analyzed: rkang pa la yam bsam zhing /
translated: One should imagine a yaṃ at her feet.

original: snying gar yang lam dang bam bsams la de dag rlung gis g-yo bar bya ba mi 'dar bar bya ba'i phyir bkod la shar phyogs su kha blta ba ni kha bstan te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snying gar yang lam dang bam bsams la de dag rlung gis g-yo bar bya ba mi 'dar bar bya ba'i phyir bkod la shar phyogs su kha blta ba ni kha bstan te zhes pa'o //
translated: One should imagine a laṃ and vaṃ at her heart, and in order to make them not move and not tremble with the wind, one should arrange them. Facing east means facing east.

original: de ltar mchod pa byas nas ni //
analyzed: de ltar mchod pa byas nas ni //
translated: Having made offerings in that way,

original: zhes pa me tog la sogs pa'i 'o //
analyzed: zhes pa me tog la sogs pa'i 'o //
translated: means with flowers and so on.

original: de yang byin gyis brlab pa'i rdzas 'di dag thod par bsregs pas bdug go //
analyzed: de yang byin gyis brlab pa'i rdzas 'di dag thod par bsregs pas bdug go //
translated: Moreover, one should burn these substances for consecration in a skull-bowl and fumigate.

original: de yang bdud rtsi lnga dang / thang chu dang / byi la'i brun dang / glad pa dag dang / ra'i yan lag lnga'i sha dang / tshil chen po dang / gu gul nag po dag bsres la ri lur byas la'o //
analyzed: de yang bdud rtsi lnga dang / thang chu dang / byi la'i brun dang / glad pa dag dang / ra'i yan lag lnga'i sha dang / tshil chen po dang / gu gul nag po dag bsres la ri lur byas la'o //
translated: Moreover, one should mix the five ambrosias, the essence of the earth, the ashes of a cat, the brains, the flesh of the five limbs of a goat, great fat, and black aloe wood, and make it into a pill.

original: de nyid kyang rlung g-yo ba la bzhag la /
analyzed: de nyid kyang rlung g-yo ba la bzhag la /
translated: Moreover, one should place it on a moving wind.

original: bdag nyid kyis yi ge bcu gcig pa bzlas shing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis yi ge bcu gcig pa bzlas shing /
translated: One should recite the eleven syllables oneself.

original: yang aa la la h'um aa zhes pa yang bzlas so //
analyzed: yang aa la la h'um aa zhes pa yang bzlas so //
translated: One should also recite “a la la hūṃ a.”

original: de dag babs na tshigs bcad dag 'don no //
analyzed: de dag babs na tshigs bcad dag 'don no //
translated: If they descend, one should recite the verses.

original: sems babs pas ni da @158b ltar la sogs pa rnams shes so //
analyzed: sems babs pas ni da @158b ltar la sogs pa rnams shes so //
translated: By the descent of the mind, one will know the present and so forth.

original: dge dang mi dge dri bar bya //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge dri bar bya //
translated: One should ask about virtue and non-virtue.

original: zhes pa ni mtshan ma bzang ba dang ngan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshan ma bzang ba dang ngan pa'o //
translated: This is the good and bad omen.

original: aa rga dbul zhes pa ni lung ston pa la'o //
analyzed: aa rga dbul zhes pa ni lung ston pa la'o //
translated: “A rga, poor” is for the prediction.

original: de nas gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: de nas gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: Then one should request them to depart.

original: sa la 'gyel zhes pa khro bo gdug pas snod de'o //
analyzed: sa la 'gyel zhes pa khro bo gdug pas snod de'o //
translated: “Falling to the ground” is the vessel of the wrathful poison.

original: bslangs nas su /
analyzed: bslangs nas su /
translated: Having raised it,

original: phyin nas rab tu khrus bya'o //
analyzed: phyin nas rab tu khrus bya'o //
translated: Having gone there, one should bathe.

original: zhes pa yang sangs rgyas la mchod pa dbul ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa yang sangs rgyas la mchod pa dbul ba'o //
translated: This also is an offering to the Buddha.

original: rgyal po dbang du byed 'dod na //
analyzed: rgyal po dbang du byed 'dod na //
translated: If one wishes to bring a king under one's power,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa la rgyal po bdag gi dbang du bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa la rgyal po bdag gi dbang du bya bar 'dod na /
translated: and so on. If one wishes to bring a king under one's power,

original: de'i tshe ri mo'i mdun du zhes pa rang gi rnal 'byor gyis khro bo'i rgyal bor dmigs shing byas pa ni mngon sum dang 'dra bas mdun du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ri mo'i mdun du zhes pa rang gi rnal 'byor gyis khro bo'i rgyal bor dmigs shing byas pa ni mngon sum dang 'dra bas mdun du zhes bya'o //
translated: at that time in front of the painting, one should visualize oneself as the Wrathful King through one's yoga. Since one acts as if in the presence of the king, it is called in front.

original: rgyal po'i rjes dang / tsandan dmar po dang / gi wang gis 'khor lo bris la de dbang gi rdzas rang gi rkang rjes dang / dur khrod kyi thal bas gzugs brnyan bris pa ni de 'dra bar byas pa'i der bcug la /
analyzed: rgyal po'i rjes dang / tsandan dmar po dang / gi wang gis 'khor lo bris la de dbang gi rdzas rang gi rkang rjes dang / dur khrod kyi thal bas gzugs brnyan bris pa ni de 'dra bar byas pa'i der bcug la /
translated: One should draw a wheel with the king's footprints, red sandalwood, and guggulu, and place it in the image made with one's own footprints and charnel ground ash.

original: sngags rtse gcig pas bzlas nas 'og tu spas na don grub pa ni 'khor lo'i mthu stobs so //
analyzed: sngags rtse gcig pas bzlas nas 'og tu spas na don grub pa ni 'khor lo'i mthu stobs so //
translated: If one recites the mantra one-pointedly and tramples it underfoot, one's purpose will be accomplished. This is the power of the wheel.

original: mthar sbyar zhes pas ni sbyin byed pa /
analyzed: mthar sbyar zhes pas ni sbyin byed pa /
translated: In the end, one should apply means one should give.

original: sha ma na ya zhes pa de'i mthar phat spangs pa'i hri sv'a h'a zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sha ma na ya zhes pa de'i mthar phat spangs pa'i hri sv'a h'a zhes pa ste /
translated: Samanaya is the seed of the mantra.🔽 Then, phaṭ is the seed of the mantra.

original: hri ni dbang du bya ba'i sa bon te /
analyzed: hri ni dbang du bya ba'i sa bon te /
translated: Then, hrīṃ is the seed of subjugation.

original: sv'a h'a zhes pa dbang du byed pa rdzogs pa'i tshig go //🔽de nas phan tshun mdza' bo gnyis //
analyzed: sv'a h'a zhes pa dbang du byed pa rdzogs pa'i tshig go // de nas phan tshun mdza' bo gnyis //
translated: Then, svāhā is the word of completion of subjugation.

original: dbye bar bya bar 'dod na ni //
analyzed: dbye bar bya bar 'dod na ni //
translated: Then, if one wishes to cause a division between two friends,

original: zhes pa dbye ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dbye ba ste /
translated: is the division.

original: 'chad par 'gyur bsam bshad do //🔽de nas sems can rab gdug par //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur bsam bshad do // de nas sems can rab gdug par //
translated: It is explained as the explanation of what is to be explained.🔽 Then, having understood that a sentient being is very wicked,

original: shes nas legs par gdul ba ni //🔽dkon mchog gsum la gnod byed na //
analyzed: shes nas legs par gdul ba ni // dkon mchog gsum la gnod byed na //
translated: the good taming🔽is done by wrath, not otherwise,

original: khro bos bya yis gzhan du min //
analyzed: khro bos bya yis gzhan du min //
translated: toward one who harms the Three Jewels.

original: zhes pa la rang gi sbyor ba drag pos gsod pa pos 'chi bdag gi drung du gtang ba na dkon mchog la gnod pa'i gdug pa 'di la bya ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la rang gi sbyor ba drag pos gsod pa pos 'chi bdag gi drung du gtang ba na dkon mchog la gnod pa'i gdug pa 'di la bya ba yin pa'o //
translated: Here, when one who is to be killed by one's own violent application is sent into the presence of the Lord of Death, it is done to this wicked one who harms the Three Jewels.

original: de yang rim pa 'di steng dur khrod kyi rdzas dang bye brag gis dang / sa'i tshil bu dang / chu'i 'gram gyi sa dang / sha chen la sogs pa la sor bcu drug pa'i tshad du de'i rnam par byas la /
analyzed: de yang rim pa 'di steng dur khrod kyi rdzas dang bye brag gis dang / sa'i tshil bu dang / chu'i 'gram gyi sa dang / sha chen la sogs pa la sor bcu drug pa'i tshad du de'i rnam par byas la /
translated: Moreover, this procedure is on top of the substances of the charnel ground and the particulars, and with the fat of the earth, the earth of the bank of a river, and human flesh, one should make a figure sixteen fingerbreadths in size.

original: dong gru gsum pa ste /
analyzed: dong gru gsum pa ste /
translated: The pit is triangular.

original: de yang lus la mtshon rus pa dang / tsher mas btsugs la nag po'i brgyad dam /
analyzed: de yang lus la mtshon rus pa dang / tsher mas btsugs la nag po'i brgyad dam /
translated: Moreover, one should pierce the body with weapons, bones, and thorns, and on the eighth day of the dark fortnight,

original: mar ngo la bya ba ste /
analyzed: mar ngo la bya ba ste /
translated: or on the waning side,

original: dngos skyed pa la gzhug par bya ba dang / sdig pa bsgrags pa dang / kha sbyor dbye ba byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: dngos skyed pa la gzhug par bya ba dang / sdig pa bsgrags pa dang / kha sbyor dbye ba byas la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: one should engage in the generation of the real thing, proclaim the misdeed, and separate the conjoined, and then do the recitation.

original: de yang 'khor lo dug gi ngo bo la che ge mo ba sha ma na ya m'a ra ya phat ces dgug go //🔽ba sha spangs pa'i 'khor lo dang gzugs @159a * //
analyzed: de yang 'khor lo dug gi ngo bo la che ge mo ba sha ma na ya m'a ra ya phat ces dgug go // ba sha spangs pa'i 'khor lo dang gzugs @159a * //
translated: Moreover, on the wheel that has the nature of poison, one should summon with “So-and-so vaśaṃ ānaya hūṃ phaṭ.”

original: brnyan de ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: brnyan de ldan par bya'o //
translated: The wheel that lacks vaśaṃ and the image should be endowed with that.

original: de nas seng ldeng phur bu la zhes pa sor brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de nas seng ldeng phur bu la zhes pa sor brgyad pa'o //
translated: Then, “on a kīla of khadira wood” is eight fingerbreadths in size.

original: brgya rtsa brgyad du rab tu bzlas te zhes pa brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa dang / rtse gcig pa btab pa'o //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad du rab tu bzlas te zhes pa brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pa dang / rtse gcig pa btab pa'o //
translated: Recite it one hundred and eight times means to recite it one hundred and eight times, and apply it one-pointedly means to apply it one-pointedly.

original: de nas bdun gyi thun mtshams su bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnam pas snying la'o //
analyzed: de nas bdun gyi thun mtshams su bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnam pas snying la'o //
translated: Then, at the end of seven days, with the form of Amṛtakuṇḍali, [recite] to the heart.

original: de'i 'og tu khri bzlas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khri bzlas so //
translated: After that, recite ten thousand times.

original: de nas yang zhag drug tu khri phrag re ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas yang zhag drug tu khri phrag re ni de bzhin no //
translated: Then, again, for six days, recite ten thousand times each day.

original: de lta bu'i btab pa khri dang / brgya dang brgyad tshang pa dang / drag por bsreg pa ste man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i btab pa khri dang / brgya dang brgyad tshang pa dang / drag por bsreg pa ste man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: In that way, the application is ten thousand times, and the complete one hundred and eight [recitations] and the fierce burning should be known from the esoteric instructions.

original: m'a ra ya h'um phat ces bya ba ni bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: m'a ra ya h'um phat ces bya ba ni bzlas pa'o //
translated: Mara ya hūṃ phaṭ is the recitation.

original: de ltar byas na sangs rgyas kyang 'jig na gzhan lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na sangs rgyas kyang 'jig na gzhan lta ci smos te /
translated: If one does it in that way, even the buddhas will be destroyed, let alone others.

original: drag po'i rnon po'i 'khor lo mthu sto bas so //
analyzed: drag po'i rnon po'i 'khor lo mthu sto bas so //
translated: It is because of the power of the sharp wheel of wrath.

original: sems can rnams la brtse ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams la brtse ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of compassion for sentient beings,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dkon mchog la gnod pa dang / bla ma la brnyas pa dag la bya ba yang /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dkon mchog la gnod pa dang / bla ma la brnyas pa dag la bya ba yang /
translated: and so forth, it is done to those who harm the three jewels and despise the guru.

original: de la snying rje dang byams pa dang ldan pa dang / zhing dag par btang bar bsams pas bya ste /
analyzed: de la snying rje dang byams pa dang ldan pa dang / zhing dag par btang bar bsams pas bya ste /
translated: One should give it with compassion and loving kindness, and with the thought of giving to a pure field.

original: de yang rlung g-yo ba la rnam par shes pa bskyon la bha ga'i gnas sam /
analyzed: de yang rlung g-yo ba la rnam par shes pa bskyon la bha ga'i gnas sam /
translated: Moreover, one should mount consciousness on the moving wind, and give it to the place of the bhaga,

original: bde ba can du mtshan bzang po dang ldan par skyes par byas la /
analyzed: bde ba can du mtshan bzang po dang ldan par skyes par byas la /
translated: or to Sukhāvatī, where one is born with excellent marks.

original: rnam par shes pa med pa'i lus la ce sbyang dang / wa dang / sbyang ki dang / bya rog dang / ma mo sha za ba dang / gnod sbyin 'jigs pa can dag la sbyin par gtang zhing de dag kyang dga' ba dang bcas pas lus de dum bur bcad cing za bar bya ba'i bsam pas zhing du nye ba dang ldan pas bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pa'i lus la ce sbyang dang / wa dang / sbyang ki dang / bya rog dang / ma mo sha za ba dang / gnod sbyin 'jigs pa can dag la sbyin par gtang zhing de dag kyang dga' ba dang bcas pas lus de dum bur bcad cing za bar bya ba'i bsam pas zhing du nye ba dang ldan pas bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should give the body without consciousness to jackals, foxes, dogs, crows, flesh-eating mamos, and fearful yakṣas. They should be happy, and with the thought of cutting up and eating that body, one should give it to them.

original: de nas bskrad pa dang / zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dpal 'dod pa dang / gter 'dod pa dang zhes pa bdag gis rnam par ma 'bad do //
analyzed: de nas bskrad pa dang / zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dpal 'dod pa dang / gter 'dod pa dang zhes pa bdag gis rnam par ma 'bad do //
translated: Then, I have not exerted myself in the rites of exorcism, pacification, increase, desire for glory, and desire for treasure.

original: tshe lhag pa la ste /
analyzed: tshe lhag pa la ste /
translated: One should do it for the remainder of one’s life.

original: tshe ring bar byas pa la d'ur bas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: tshe ring bar byas pa la d'ur bas sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: For longevity, one should perform the homa of durva.

original: rtog pa phyi ma'i rtog pa le'u brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rtog pa phyi ma'i rtog pa le'u brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of chapter eight of the second part of the explanatory tantra called “The Subsequent Tantra.”

original: // / de nas rtog pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: // / de nas rtog pa thams cad kyi phyi ma'i phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Then, it is said, “Subsequent to all the tantras,” and so on.

original: phyi ma kho na yin yang 'di las te /
analyzed: phyi ma kho na yin yang 'di las te /
translated: Although it is only subsequent, it is from this.

original: 'di dag de'i yang phyi mar phyag na rdo rjes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di dag de'i yang phyi mar phyag na rdo rjes bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained by Vajrapāṇi as subsequent to that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir de'i dgongs pa yang zab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir de'i dgongs pa yang zab ste /
translated: Since it is the transcendent state of the tathāgatas, his transcendent state is also profound.

original: zab pa gnyis bzhi la sogs pas zab pa'i don yod pas gzhan du rnam par bshad do zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zab pa gnyis bzhi la sogs pas zab pa'i don yod pas gzhan du rnam par bshad do zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Since there are profound meanings of two, four, and so on, it should be understood that it is explained elsewhere.

original: de yang bka' mtha' yas ni nges pa'i don dang / drang ba'i don dang / dgongs pa can gyi don dang / dgongs @159b pa'i don gyis zab bo //
analyzed: de yang bka' mtha' yas ni nges pa'i don dang / drang ba'i don dang / dgongs pa can gyi don dang / dgongs @159b pa'i don gyis zab bo //
translated: Moreover, the infinite words are profound because of the definitive meaning, the interpretable meaning, the meaning with an intention, and the meaning without an intention.

original: de yang nges pa yi ni rten cing 'brel pa sgyu mar bshad pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang da ltar gyi tha dad par bshad pa dag mchan nyid kyi de kho na nyid na'o //
analyzed: de yang nges pa yi ni rten cing 'brel pa sgyu mar bshad pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang da ltar gyi tha dad par bshad pa dag mchan nyid kyi de kho na nyid na'o //
translated: Moreover, the reality of the definitive meaning is explained in the illusion-like dependent origination and the explanation of the difference between past and present consciousness.

original: drang ba'i don na rnam pa bzhi'i sbyor bas lha'i de kho na bsgoms pas sa thob par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: drang ba'i don na rnam pa bzhi'i sbyor bas lha'i de kho na bsgoms pas sa thob par bshad pa ste /
translated: In the interpretable meaning, the attainment of the stages is explained by the practice of the four kinds of divine reality cultivation.

original: khad kyis don zab mo la gzhug pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhug pa'i de kho na zab pa'o //
analyzed: khad kyis don zab mo la gzhug pa'i phyir ro zhes gzhug pa'i de kho na zab pa'o //
translated: The reality of introduction is profound because it is for the purpose of gradually introducing one to the profound meaning.

original: dgongs pa'i de kho na ni sangs rgyas kun yin zer ba dang / dus gsum gyi sngon du byung zhes pa dang / khyod kyis gzhan bsad na grol zhes pa dag ni dgongs pa'i de kho na ste zab ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i de kho na ni sangs rgyas kun yin zer ba dang / dus gsum gyi sngon du byung zhes pa dang / khyod kyis gzhan bsad na grol zhes pa dag ni dgongs pa'i de kho na ste zab ba'o //
translated: The reality of intention is profound because it is the intention of the Buddhas, such as the statements, “I am all the Buddhas,” “I appeared before the three times,” and “You will be liberated by killing others.”

original: dgongs pa'i don ni gzhan du bstan pas shes rab 'phel bas ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i don ni gzhan du bstan pas shes rab 'phel bas ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: The reality of intention is the intention because it is taught for the purpose of increasing wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'di la 'jug pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / bsgom pa 'phel ba ni dgos pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la 'jug pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / bsgom pa 'phel ba ni dgos pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the purpose here is the increase of engagement, intelligence, and cultivation.

original: 'dir bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bzung ba yin no //
translated: This is what is meant here.

original: 'o na 'di'i dgongs pa zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di'i dgongs pa zhe na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: dus de nyid la yang skad cig ma dag gis de la yang snga ma dang phyi ma gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: dus de nyid la yang skad cig ma dag gis de la yang snga ma dang phyi ma gzigs pa'o //
translated: In that very moment, he sees the earlier and later moments.

original: 'o na lha rjes su dran pa drang ba'i don yin na /
analyzed: 'o na lha rjes su dran pa drang ba'i don yin na /
translated: If the recollection of the deity is provisional,

original: rjes su dran pa gzhan ci zhe na /🔽smras pa / rnam pa bzhi yi sbyor ba yis //🔽lha ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa gzhan ci zhe na / smras pa / rnam pa bzhi yi sbyor ba yis // lha ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
translated: what is the other recollection?🔽It is said:🔽The recollection of the deity is cultivated through the application of four aspects.

original: lha ni rjes su dran pa yis //🔽sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom //
analyzed: lha ni rjes su dran pa yis // sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom //
translated: Through the recollection of the deity,🔽the recollection of the Buddha is cultivated.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yis //🔽chos ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yis // chos ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
translated: Through the recollection of the Buddha,🔽the recollection of the Dharma is cultivated.

original: chos rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: chos rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: Through the application of the recollection of the Dharma,

original: sgyu ma rjes su dran pa bsgom //
analyzed: sgyu ma rjes su dran pa bsgom //
translated: the recollection of illusion is cultivated.

original: sku ni rjes su dran pa yis //🔽rigs ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
analyzed: sku ni rjes su dran pa yis // rigs ni rjes su dran pa bsgom //
translated: Through the recollection of the body,🔽the recollection of the family is cultivated.

original: rigs rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rigs rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: Through the application of the recollection of the family,

original: sngags rjes dran pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sngags rjes dran pa bsgom par bya //
translated: the recollection of the mantra is cultivated.

original: sngags rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sngags rjes dran pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: Through the application of the recollection of the mantra,

original: sems rjes dran pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sems rjes dran pa bsgom par bya //
translated: the recollection of the mind is cultivated.

original: zhes bshad pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: This is the distinction.

original: des na gzhan nges pa'i don du 'dir bshad do //
analyzed: des na gzhan nges pa'i don du 'dir bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the other is explained here as definitive in meaning.

original: rnal 'byor de dag bsgom pa yang dbang bskur bas bya ba yin te /🔽thog mar dbang rnams legs thab pa'i //
analyzed: rnal 'byor de dag bsgom pa yang dbang bskur bas bya ba yin te / thog mar dbang rnams legs thab pa'i //
translated: Moreover, the cultivation of those yogas is to be done by means of initiation.🔽First, the guru, who is skilled in the magic

original: bla ma sgyu ma rig pas gnang //
analyzed: bla ma sgyu ma rig pas gnang //
translated: of initiation, grants it.🔽Thus, one who is skilled in the magic of initiation is the guru of the middle wheel.

original: zhes pas na /🔽sgyu ma rig pa dbang thob pa ni dbu ma'i la ma ste /
analyzed: zhes pas na / sgyu ma rig pa dbang thob pa ni dbu ma'i la ma ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: de yang / rten cing skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: de yang / rten cing skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: That which is dependently arisen has not arisen.

original: de la skyes zhes su smra ba //
analyzed: de la skyes zhes su smra ba //
translated: How can one say that it has arisen?

original: rkyen las byung ba'i don ma mthong //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i don ma mthong //
translated: One who does not see the meaning of arising from conditions

original: rang gi ngo bor ma skyes pa //🔽rkyen las skyes te rgyu yang zhi //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ma skyes pa // rkyen las skyes te rgyu yang zhi //
translated: has not arisen from its own essence.🔽Arising from conditions is pacified.

original: zhi ba rgyu dang rkyen 'bras min //
analyzed: zhi ba rgyu dang rkyen 'bras min //
translated: Pacification is not a result of causes and conditions.

original: zhes pa dang yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang yang /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: gcig gi ngo bor ma byung dang // gcig gi ngo bor ma grub pa //
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bor ma byung dang // gcig gi ngo bor ma grub pa //
translated: Not arisen as a single essence, not established as a single essence,

original: du ma byung dang du mar me //
analyzed: du ma byung dang du mar me //
translated: not arisen as many, not many,

original: rang bzhin zhi ba @160a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhi ba @160a * //
translated: the pacified nature

original: 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: is clear light.

original: gsal ba du ma du 'byung min //
analyzed: gsal ba du ma du 'byung min //
translated: Clear light does not arise as many.

original: zhes pa ni dbu ma'i don te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbu ma'i don te /
translated: This is the meaning of the middle wheel.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni //🔽rgyu las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni // rgyu las 'byung ba ste /
translated: Dependent origination🔽arises from causes.

original: rgyu tshogs pa las 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa las 'byung ba ni //
translated: Arising from a collection of causes

original: rang byung ba ma yin bas rkye na la ltos pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos ma byung bas /
analyzed: rang byung ba ma yin bas rkye na la ltos pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos ma byung bas /
translated: is not self-arisen because it depends on conditions. Therefore, it does not arise by its own nature.

original: dngos po med do //
analyzed: dngos po med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not a thing.

original: yang rgyu las rang gis nus pa rang gi ngo bo yod pas rgyu gzhan med do zhe na /
analyzed: yang rgyu las rang gis nus pa rang gi ngo bo yod pas rgyu gzhan med do zhe na /
translated: Again, if you say that because the potency of an effect exists in its cause by its own nature, there is no other cause,

original: rkye na las byung ba'i don ma mthong zhes gzhan dag las gsungs pas na /
analyzed: rkye na las byung ba'i don ma mthong zhes gzhan dag las gsungs pas na /
translated: then since it is said by others that “the meaning of arising from conditions is not seen,”

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu gcig par smra ba'i rmongs pa ni blo gros dman pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu gcig par smra ba'i rmongs pa ni blo gros dman pa ste /
translated: the confused who propound that the effect and cause are the same are of little intelligence.

original: rkyen las byung ba'i don du ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i don du ma shes pa'o //
translated: They do not understand the meaning of arising from conditions.

original: rang gi ngo bor ma skyes pas //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ma skyes pas //
translated: Since it does not arise by its own nature,

original: zhes pa lan te rmongs par bstan nas /
analyzed: zhes pa lan te rmongs par bstan nas /
translated: this is the response. Having taught the confusion,

original: 'bras bu myu gu bdag ma thob pas sa bon la snga ma nas yod na rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu myu gu bdag ma thob pas sa bon la snga ma nas yod na rang bzhin bye brag tu gyur pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: since the effect, the sprout, does not obtain its own nature, if it existed in the seed previously, it would not have a different nature.

original: gang rgyu yin la gang 'bras bur gzhag pa dang / 'bras bu yang sa bon snang ba nas mthong bar rigs pa las /
analyzed: gang rgyu yin la gang 'bras bur gzhag pa dang / 'bras bu yang sa bon snang ba nas mthong bar rigs pa las /
translated: The cause is posited as the cause of the effect, and the effect is posited as the effect of the cause.🔽But since the effect is not seen arising from the cause, it is not established as existent by the non-observation of the appearing.

original: ma mthong ba snang ba mi dmigs pas yod par ma 'grub ba'i phyir bdag gi yod pa las skyes pa ma yin pas rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba snang ba mi dmigs pas yod par ma 'grub ba'i phyir bdag gi yod pa las skyes pa ma yin pas rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since it does not arise from the existence of the self, it arises from a cause.

original: de phyir yang dag par ma grub po zhes khas blang ngo //
analyzed: de phyir yang dag par ma grub po zhes khas blang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that it is not truly established.

original: 'o na rgyu rtag pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu rtag pa'o zhe na /
translated: Well, is the cause permanent?

original: rgyu yang zhi zhes pas na sgyu yang rang gi ngo bos kyang stong la /
analyzed: rgyu yang zhi zhes pas na sgyu yang rang gi ngo bos kyang stong la /
translated: Since the cause is also peace, the illusion is also empty of its own entity.

original: de yang rgyu gzhan la ma ltos par ma byung bas na /
analyzed: de yang rgyu gzhan la ma ltos par ma byung bas na /
translated: Moreover, since it does not occur without depending on another cause,

original: zhi ba ste rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba ste rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: it is peace, not permanent.

original: 'o na zhi ba'i ngo bo ra grub bam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na zhi ba'i ngo bo ra grub bam zhe na /
translated: Well, is the entity of peace established?

original: zhi ba rgyu dang rkyen 'bras min //
analyzed: zhi ba rgyu dang rkyen 'bras min //
translated: Peace is not the cause or condition of the effect.

original: zhes pa gsungs pas na /
analyzed: zhes pa gsungs pas na /
translated: Since this is stated,

original: zhi ba yang yang dag par ma grub ste rgyu yang ma yin /
analyzed: zhi ba yang yang dag par ma grub ste rgyu yang ma yin /
translated: peace is also not truly established. It is not the cause.

original: rkyen yang ma yin /
analyzed: rkyen yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the condition.

original: 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the effect.

original: spros dang rnam par cha da pa ' mtshan ma'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros dang rnam par cha da pa ' mtshan ma'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no basis for the characteristics of elaboration and differentiation.

original: des na dbu ma'i don rig pa ni /
analyzed: des na dbu ma'i don rig pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the meaning of the middle way

original: sgyu ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma rig pa'o //
translated: is the knowledge of illusion.

original: 'bras bu de gcig tu ma byung ste chos mang bar byung ba dang / gcig gi ngo bo ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu de gcig tu ma byung ste chos mang bar byung ba dang / gcig gi ngo bo ma grub ste /
translated: That result does not arise as one, but arises as many phenomena, and it does not exist as a single entity,

original: sna tshogs pa dang / cha'i bye brag gis gcig ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang / cha'i bye brag gis gcig ma grub pa'o //
translated: but is diverse and not established as one by its specific parts.🔽Then, by this reasoning of the absence of multiplicity, there is also no correct establishment.

original: de nas du ma yang med pa'i rigs ba 'dis na yang dag par grub pa med do zhes pa yang rigs pa'i don rnam par dpyad na gang btsal ba'i don la shes pa des btsal na /
analyzed: de nas du ma yang med pa'i rigs ba 'dis na yang dag par grub pa med do zhes pa yang rigs pa'i don rnam par dpyad na gang btsal ba'i don la shes pa des btsal na /
translated: When the meaning of reasoning is analyzed, if the object that is sought is sought by that consciousness,

original: dngos po sgyu ma 'di la yang dag pa'i mtha' spros pa rnam par chad pa la nges pa 'dzin pa rjes su dpag pa 'dis bzung ba ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po sgyu ma 'di la yang dag pa'i mtha' spros pa rnam par chad pa la nges pa 'dzin pa rjes su dpag pa 'dis bzung ba ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: in this illusory thing, the correct limit is ascertained in the absence of conceptual elaborations.

original: des na snang @160b ba la rjes su dpyod pas nges par skye ste rig pa'o //
analyzed: des na snang @160b ba la rjes su dpyod pas nges par skye ste rig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by analyzing appearances, certainty arises, which is knowledge.

original: yul gnyis ba can yin pas na shes pa 'di yang gnyis su rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: yul gnyis ba can yin pas na shes pa 'di yang gnyis su rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Since it has two objects, this consciousness is also posited as twofold:

original: rang gi snang ba rig pa dang stong pa la dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi snang ba rig pa dang stong pa la dpyod pa'o //
translated: the awareness of its own appearance and the analysis of emptiness.

original: ngo bo la khyad par med kyi tha dad pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo la khyad par med kyi tha dad pa nyid yin na /
translated: If there is no difference in essence but there is difference in itself,

original: 'o na chos can gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chos can gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what is the subject?

original: smras ba bya ka ra na 'i sgra'i lugs dang / rigs pa'i sgo nas don rnam par gzhag pa la /
analyzed: smras ba bya ka ra na 'i sgra'i lugs dang / rigs pa'i sgo nas don rnam par gzhag pa la /
translated: It is said that in the system of the grammar of the bird karaṇḍa and in the system of logic,

original: sgra'i sbyor ba'i byed pa dang / rigs pa'i tshul gyis gzhan la don go bar byed pas na /
analyzed: sgra'i sbyor ba'i byed pa dang / rigs pa'i tshul gyis gzhan la don go bar byed pas na /
translated: the function of the application of grammar and the system of logic make the meaning understood for others.

original: rnam par gzhag pa mtha' yas su rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa mtha' yas su rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Therefore, it is posited as an infinite presentation,

original: chos dang chos can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the subject, predicate, and so on.

original: don tsam ston pa ni 'di ka ba yin zhes brjod na sgra de dang 'di ka ba yin snyam pa'i blo skye ba des don brjod pa dang / blo'i yul snang ba'am yul zhen pa de dngos po brjod cing yul bzung ba ni /
analyzed: don tsam ston pa ni 'di ka ba yin zhes brjod na sgra de dang 'di ka ba yin snyam pa'i blo skye ba des don brjod pa dang / blo'i yul snang ba'am yul zhen pa de dngos po brjod cing yul bzung ba ni /
translated: When it is said, “This is a pillar,” if the meaning is merely indicated, the word and the thought “This is a pillar” express the meaning and the appearance of the object of the mind or the apprehension of the object. The expression of the object and the apprehension of the object

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa brjod cing bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa brjod cing bzung ba yin te /
translated: It is neither of those two, and it is apprehended and expressed.

original: chos can yang ma brjod la gnyi ga ma bzung ngo zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos can yang ma brjod la gnyi ga ma bzung ngo zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the subject is not expressed and both are not apprehended.

original: de khyad par du shes par 'dod nas sgra sbyor ba na /
analyzed: de khyad par du shes par 'dod nas sgra sbyor ba na /
translated: When one wishes to know that distinction, the term is applied.

original: ka ba mi rtag ces brjod pa'i sgra dang / blo de ltar skye ba ni chos su 'dra bar rigs pas grub kyang ste /
analyzed: ka ba mi rtag ces brjod pa'i sgra dang / blo de ltar skye ba ni chos su 'dra bar rigs pas grub kyang ste /
translated: The term “the pillar is impermanent” and the cognition that arises in that way are similar in being established by reasoning as the same phenomenon.

original: chos can du ka ba gzhag go //
analyzed: chos can du ka ba gzhag go //
translated: The subject is posited as the pillar.

original: ka ba ma yin pa dag rigs su bsdus pa gcig las ldog pa ka ba yin la /
analyzed: ka ba ma yin pa dag rigs su bsdus pa gcig las ldog pa ka ba yin la /
translated: That which is not a pillar is included in the class of non-pillar. The opposite of that is a pillar.

original: ka ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang rigs ma bsdus pa yin pa'i ngo bo gcig las log pa brjod pa dang shes pa skye ba'i brjod bya dang yul dag ngo bo khyad par med pa'i tshul yin te /
analyzed: ka ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo yang rigs ma bsdus pa yin pa'i ngo bo gcig las log pa brjod pa dang shes pa skye ba'i brjod bya dang yul dag ngo bo khyad par med pa'i tshul yin te /
translated: The essence of that which is not a pillar is the opposite of the essence of that which is not included in the class of non-pillar. The expressed object and the object of the arising of the cognition are similar in being the same essence.

original: log pa'i phyogs dang / log pa'i ngo bo la mang ba'am nyung ba'i khyad par la sogs pa med kyang de'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba'i don gyis ngo bo la gzhi zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: log pa'i phyogs dang / log pa'i ngo bo la mang ba'am nyung ba'i khyad par la sogs pa med kyang de'i khyad par rtogs par bya ba'i don gyis ngo bo la gzhi zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Although there is no difference of many or few in the aspect of the unreal and the nature of the unreal, the nature is posited as the basis for the purpose of understanding its difference,

original: chos can du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos can du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: or it is posited as the subject.

original: don la brten pa'i khyad par ni mang du gnas pa'i ngo bo ma grub pa'i sngo ser mi dmigs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: don la brten pa'i khyad par ni mang du gnas pa'i ngo bo ma grub pa'i sngo ser mi dmigs pa bzhin te /
translated: The difference based on meaning is like the non-observation of blue and yellow that do not establish the nature of many things.

original: dngos po gang gi yang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa smra'am /
analyzed: dngos po gang gi yang sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa smra'am /
translated: Do you say that it has the reason for the application of the term of any thing?

original: rigs pas ngo bor tha snyad gzhag pa'i don gang yin pa khyad par 'du shes par bya ba dang bcas pa ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas ngo bor tha snyad gzhag pa'i don gang yin pa khyad par 'du shes par bya ba dang bcas pa ni chos can yin no //
translated: That which is the object of the conventional designation as the nature by reasoning, together with the discernment of the difference, is the subject.

original: dngos po med pa'i mdzes pa ni med pas chos so zhes shes par bya'i mang ba las log pa dang / gcig las log ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mdzes pa ni med pas chos so zhes shes par bya'i mang ba las log pa dang / gcig las log ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no beauty of non-existence, it should be understood as the predicate, not because of being different from many or different from one.

original: de'i ngo bo dang / de'i khyad par gyi tshul rnam pa gnyis su klu grub pa las thos shing @161a * //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dang / de'i khyad par gyi tshul rnam pa gnyis su klu grub pa las thos shing @161a * //
translated: The two aspects of its nature and its distinctive ways are to be understood from Nāgārjuna.

original: rigs pa yin no zhes gzhan dag kyang zung shig pa ni tshul gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa yin no zhes gzhan dag kyang zung shig pa ni tshul gcig pa'o //
translated: And it is reasonable is the single way of understanding.

original: 'di la rnam pa gzhan du yang 'dod pa ni mang yang sgra tsam la zhen par rig pas ni grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rnam pa gzhan du yang 'dod pa ni mang yang sgra tsam la zhen par rig pas ni grub pa'o //
translated: Here, there are many other assertions, but it is established by reasoning that they are mere attachment to words.

original: 'on kyang da rung blos btsal zhing dpyad pa ni gnang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang da rung blos btsal zhing dpyad pa ni gnang ngo //
translated: However, it is still allowed to search with the mind and investigate.

original: le'u dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: le'u dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of chapter 9 is finished.

original: // / da ni 'bru gcig pa'i sngags dang / de'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba bstan pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni 'bru gcig pa'i sngags dang / de'i dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba bstan pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the mantra of the single syllable and the empowerment conferred in its maṇḍala will be explained.

original: de'i phyir gshin rje rab 'joms 'di //
analyzed: de'i phyir gshin rje rab 'joms 'di //
translated: Therefore, this Yamāntaka

original: zhal ni h'um zhes bya bar bshad //
analyzed: zhal ni h'um zhes bya bar bshad //
translated: is explained as the face of hūṃ.

original: ces ba smos te /🔽gshin rje ni yi dags te /
analyzed: ces ba smos te / gshin rje ni yi dags te /
translated: This is said.🔽Yama is a hungry ghost.

original: rang bas stobs chung ba dag gi sems can gyi bdud byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang bas stobs chung ba dag gi sems can gyi bdud byed pa ste /
translated: He is the māra of sentient beings who are weaker than himself.

original: gang nas shi 'phos nas gnas ngan par song ba ni shi ba sngon du song ba yin pas gshin zhes bya bar dgongs la /
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos nas gnas ngan par song ba ni shi ba sngon du song ba yin pas gshin zhes bya bar dgongs la /
translated: Since those who die and go to a bad place have already died, he is called Yama, “the lord of death.”

original: de'i dbang yang byed pa rje ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang yang byed pa rje ste /
translated: He is also called Yama because he acts as the lord of those who have died.

original: de yang 'jig rten dbang che ba rnams so //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten dbang che ba rnams so //
translated: Moreover, he is the lord of the world.

original: de'i rnam par 'jig par byed pa ni gshin rje /
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'jig par byed pa ni gshin rje /
translated: He is Yama, the destroyer of their forms.

original: de yang phyogs skyong ba las /
analyzed: de yang phyogs skyong ba las /
translated: He is also the guardian of the directions.

original: las mthu che ba'i gshed ni /
analyzed: las mthu che ba'i gshed ni /
translated: The powerful lord of death is

original: 'phags pa ste khyad par du gyur pa'i ye shes te de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ste khyad par du gyur pa'i ye shes te de las byung ba'o //
translated: the noble one, the special wisdom, and he arises from that.

original: de'i lhan cig pa'i bsgrub pa dang / snying po gcig pa'i sgrub thabs su rnam par bshad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lhan cig pa'i bsgrub pa dang / snying po gcig pa'i sgrub thabs su rnam par bshad par shes par bya'o //
translated: His accomplices and the method of the single essence should be understood as explained in the Means of Accomplishment.

original: tha ma dag tu zhes pa ni dbus su ro bri ba dang / de'i phyi skor la ro'i phreng ba dang / de'i yang mthar thod pa'i phred ba la tha mar bshad do //
analyzed: tha ma dag tu zhes pa ni dbus su ro bri ba dang / de'i phyi skor la ro'i phreng ba dang / de'i yang mthar thod pa'i phred ba la tha mar bshad do //
translated: The “ends” are explained as the drawing of the corpse in the center, the garland of corpses around it, and the garland of skulls at the very end.

original: grva bzhi ni gru chad do //
analyzed: grva bzhi ni gru chad do //
translated: The four corners are the four corners.

original: thod ba dag kyang phreng bar bya //
analyzed: thod ba dag kyang phreng bar bya //
translated: The skulls are also made into a garland.

original: zhes pa ni lcags ri'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lcags ri'i'o //
translated: This is the iron fence.

original: khro bo'i spyan sngar 'dug nas su //
analyzed: khro bo'i spyan sngar 'dug nas su //
translated: Sitting in the presence of the wrathful one,

original: zhes pa rnal 'byor byas pa'i 'og tu sngags gdon pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rnal 'byor byas pa'i 'og tu sngags gdon pa'o //
translated: This is the recitation of the mantra after performing the yoga.

original: dur khrod gnas su slob ma gzung //
analyzed: dur khrod gnas su slob ma gzung //
translated: Taking the disciple in the charnel ground abode,

original: ces pa ni slob ma dur khrod kyi gnas te 'jam dpal gyi dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni slob ma dur khrod kyi gnas te 'jam dpal gyi dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa'o //
translated: This is the charnel ground abode of the disciple, the entry into the Mañjuśrī maṇḍala.

original: h'um bzlas shing gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: h'um bzlas shing gzhug pa'o //
translated: Entering with the recitation of hūṃ,

original: h'um bzhag ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo ste lha la bshad pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: h'um bzhag ba ni rgyu'i ngo bo ste lha la bshad pa ni man ngag go //
translated: The placement of hūṃ is the nature of the cause. Explaining to the deity is the esoteric instruction.

original: de nas sh'u la'i phyag rgya ni //
analyzed: de nas sh'u la'i phyag rgya ni //
translated: Then, the śūla mudra,

original: ras kyis g-yogs te bcing bar bya //
analyzed: ras kyis g-yogs te bcing bar bya //
translated: Covered with cloth, one should bind.

analyzed: de nas skyabs su 'gro ba'o //

original: de na khro bo'i 'khor lo ni /
analyzed: de na khro bo'i 'khor lo ni /
translated: The wrathful cakra🔽is the extensive one with the rite.

original: cho gar bcas pa rgyas pa dag / ces pa la khro bo ni 'bar phreng la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cho gar bcas pa rgyas pa dag / ces pa la khro bo ni 'bar phreng la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wrathful ones are the garland of flames, and so on.

original: de'i 'khor lo ni de'i tshogs nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'khor lo ni de'i tshogs nyid do //
translated: The cakra of that is the assembly of those.

original: de'i cho ga'i rim pa ni /
analyzed: de'i cho ga'i rim pa ni /
translated: The stages of the rite of that are

original: bla mas bstan pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bla mas bstan pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The stages taught by the guru.

original: rim pa de gsang zhing sba bar bya ba yin pas gsal bar ma bshad do //
analyzed: rim pa de gsang zhing sba bar bya ba yin pas gsal bar ma bshad do //
translated: Since that stage is to be kept secret, it is not explained clearly.

original: mi shes pa ni rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni rmongs pa ste /
translated: Ignorance is delusion.

original: gdams ngag dang rgyud mtha' dag thos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gdams ngag dang rgyud mtha' dag thos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: It is the absence of hearing the oral instructions and all the tantras.

original: da ni 'khor lo bri ba bshad de /
analyzed: da ni 'khor lo bri ba bshad de /
translated: Now, the drawing of the cakra is explained.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / 'khor lo rtsibs kyi nang rnams ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'khor lo rtsibs kyi nang rnams ni /
translated: the inner parts of the spokes of the cakra

original: de dang de dag gnyis su sbyar /
analyzed: de dang de dag gnyis su sbyar /
translated: are joined in pairs.

original: zhes pas / ri mo rnam pa gsum du bya la /
analyzed: zhes pas / ri mo rnam pa gsum du bya la /
translated: Since it is said that three types of lines are drawn,

original: gnyis su sbyor zhes pas 'khor lo nyis rim mo //
analyzed: gnyis su sbyor zhes pas 'khor lo nyis rim mo //
translated: since it is said that they are joined in pairs, the cakra is two-layered.

original: de bzhin 'khor lo'i nang du yang //
analyzed: de bzhin 'khor lo'i nang du yang //
translated: Also, in the center of the cakra

original: zhes pa lte ba la'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lte ba la'o //
translated: means in the center.

original: de ni 'khor lo'i dbus su yin pas nang ste de nyid kyi nang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'khor lo'i dbus su yin pas nang ste de nyid kyi nang ni ma yin no //
translated: Since that is in the center of the cakra, it is inner, but it is not the center.

original: mtha' ni kun gyi mtha' ste /
analyzed: mtha' ni kun gyi mtha' ste /
translated: The end is the end of all.

original: dbang la dri la bu dkrol ba'o //
analyzed: dbang la dri la bu dkrol ba'o //
translated: It is the explanation of the smell of the son.

original: 'khor lo'i mu ran nang dag tu //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i mu ran nang dag tu //
translated: In the inner rim of the cakra

original: ces pa ni 'khor lo la khro bo dang de'i mthar ma m'a dang / de nas ba sha ma na ya ho zhes pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'khor lo la khro bo dang de'i mthar ma m'a dang / de nas ba sha ma na ya ho zhes pa ni man ngag go //
translated: Then, “vaśaṃ naya ho” is the esoteric instruction.🔽In “mūrṇa la saṃgha” there are two letters and two urgings,

original: mur na la zung gcig pa'i yi ge dang skul ba dag dang // ho la sogs pa phye bas dgod de sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: mur na la zung gcig pa'i yi ge dang skul ba dag dang // ho la sogs pa phye bas dgod de sgra ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: and “ho” and so forth are the divisions, as it is.

original: gzhan du na khro bo bzhi sum cu gnyis su rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na khro bo bzhi sum cu gnyis su rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: Otherwise, the four wrathful ones are situated in thirty-two places.

original: khro bo gshin rje gshed kyi sngags /
analyzed: khro bo gshin rje gshed kyi sngags /
translated: The mantra of Yamāntaka, the wrathful one, is:

original: aom ya m'anta krid ya ma r'a dza sa do me ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ya m'anta krid ya ma r'a dza sa do me ya sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ yamāntakṛt yamāraya sadomāya svāhā.

original: khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i sngags /
analyzed: khro bo gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i sngags /
translated: The mantra of Aparājita, the wrathful one, is:

original: aom pradzny'a nta krid ya me do ru na yo da ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom pradzny'a nta krid ya me do ru na yo da ya sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ prajñāntakṛt yamāraya dorunayo dāya svāhā.

original: khro bo rta mgrin gyi sngags /
analyzed: khro bo rta mgrin gyi sngags /
translated: The mantra of Hayagrīva, the wrathful one, is:
